snippet: Top-seeded Tommy Haas retired with a shoulder injury while losing to Paolo Lorenzi in the Brazil Open semifinals in São Paulo.
lead_paragraph: Top-seeded Tommy Haas retired with a shoulder injury while losing to Paolo Lorenzi in the Brazil Open semifinals in São Paulo.

headline.print_headline: haas forced out of match Top-seeded Tommy Haas retired with a shoulder injury while losing, 6-3, 3-2, to Paolo Lorenzi in the Brazil Open semifinals in São Paulo. Haas said he “felt a lot of pain” in his right shoulder when he slammed his racket to the ground in frustration after losing his serve at 3-3 in the first set. He kept playing despite needing medical treatment several times, but gave up after going down another break in the second set.
